turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Girls -- I'm going to Harvard!

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: What, like on va-kay?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Calvin Klein's spring line is atrocious. Don't you agree?

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: Absolutely!

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Almost.

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: Well, hurry up so you can come home! We miss you!

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I miss you guys! The people here are so vile! Hardly anyone even talks to me unless it's to say something that's not nice. Law school sucks!

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: Oh, my God! I completely forgot to tell you!

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: I got bangs!

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Really --

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: What're you doing here?!

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: We're on our way to the bridal show in New York so we thought we'd rescue you from law school for the night.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You guys -- I can't. We're in the middle of a trial.

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: Where's Warner?

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: I wish we could stay longer, but I have a game.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I can't believe you're a Laker Girl!

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Neither.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DONOVAN
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I'd rather have a client who's innocent.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DONOVAN
turns.text: Yes? Ms. Woods?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I changed my mind. I'd pick the dangerous one.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I did?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DONOVAN
turns.text: You're applying for my internship, aren't you?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I don't know --

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DONOVAN
turns.text: You should. Do you have a resume?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DONOVAN
turns.text: It's pink.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: And engraved... Gives it that extra little something, doesn't it?  See you tomorrow!

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DONOVAN
turns.text: Maiden name -- Daniels.  You know her?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: She was a Delta Gamma! Not in my pledge class or anything -- she graduated five years ahead of me. But I used to take her class at the LA Sports Club. She's amazing!

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DONOVAN
turns.text: Amazing how?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: She could make you drop three pounds in one class. She's completely gifted!

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DONOVAN
turns.text: Well, in all likelihood, she's completely guilty as well. She was seen standing over her husband's dead body.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DONOVAN
turns.text: His twenty-seven year old daughter and the pool boy.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Maybe she found him like that.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DONOVAN
turns.text: That's the story she'll be telling the jury. We just have to prove it.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DONOVAN
turns.text: You don't really believe she's innocent?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Of course, I do!

turns.speaker: FUZZY 2L
turns.text: Class schedule, map, book list.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Has Warner Huntington checked in yet?

turns.speaker: FUZZY 2L
turns.text: Uh, no. Maybe you should try the Lido deck.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Wait -- my social events schedule is missing.

turns.speaker: FUZZY 2L
turns.text: Your what?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You know -- mixers, formals, beach trips.

turns.speaker: FUZZY 2L
turns.text: There's a pizza welcome lunch in twenty minutes. Does that count?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I guess it'll have to...

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: You're beautiful.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: So are you!

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I'm fully amenable to that discussion.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: I mean, we're having a lot of fun now -- but things are gonna be different when I'm at Harvard. Law school is a completely different world. I need to be serious.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: My family expects a lot from me. And I expect a lot from me. I plan on running for office some day.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: And I fully support that.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: But the thing is, if I'm gonna be a senator by the time I'm thirty -- I can't keep dicking around.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I completely agree.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: That's why I think it's time for us to --

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: I'm sorry, Elle, I just --

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You're breaking up with me?!  I thought you were proposing.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Proposing?! Elle, If I'm going to be a politician, I need to marry a Jackie, not a -- Marilyn.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You're breaking up with me because I'm too -- blonde?

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: That's not entirely --

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Then what? My boobs are too big?

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Elle -- no -- your boobs are fine --

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: C'mon. Let me take you home.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Elle -- it's twenty miles back to campus.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Elle, believe me, I never expected to be doing this, but I think it's the right thing to do.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: How can it be the right thing if we're not together?

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: I have to think about my future. And what people expect from me.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: So you're breaking up with me because you're afraid your family won't like me?  Everybody likes me!

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: East coast people are different.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Just because I'm not a Vanderbilt, all of a sudden I'm white trash? I grew up in Bel Air, Warner! Across the street from Aaron Spelling! I think most people would agree that's way better than a Vanderbilt --

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: I told you, Elle. I need someone -- serious.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I'm seriously in love with you -- Isn't that enough?

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: What're you talking about? You're not here to see me?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: No, silly. I go here.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: You go where?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Harvard. Law school.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: You got into Harvard Law?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: What, like it's that hard?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Oops! Time for class. Meet me after? On the benches?

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Uh -- sure.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: So -- uh -- how was your first class?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Fine. Except for this horrible girl who made me look bad in front of my Civ Pro professor. But no biggie. You're here now.  How was your summer?

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Good. Good.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Do anything exciting?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I'm sorry, I just hallucinated.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Sarah was my girlfriend at prep school. We got back together over the summer at my grandmother's birthday party.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Wow. You're a walking felony.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Thank you. Having fun?

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Now I am.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I feel like we've barely spent any time together since we got here.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: That's because I spend all my time with case studies and hypos.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Tell me about it. I can't imagine doing all this and Donovan's internship next year.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Elle, c'mon, there's no way you'll get the grades to qualify for one of those spots. You're not smart enough.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: I didn't mean --

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Am I on glue, or did I not get into the same law school you did, Warner?

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Well, yeah, but --

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: But what? We took the same LSAT, we take the same classes --

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: I just don't want to see you get your hopes up. You know how you get.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: You look -- nice.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: If you tell him, you'll probably make summer associate. Who cares about Brooke? Think about yourself.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I gave her my word, Warner.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Pink ones.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: See?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Thanks for the backup.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: How was I supposed to know what kind of shoes you had on?

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: It made me realize something. I'm an idiot.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: In court. On opposing sides.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Are you serious?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Huh. Imagine that. Looks like I am.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Did you ever take Mrs. Windham on a date?

turns.speaker: ENRIQUE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: ENRIQUE
turns.text: A restaurant in Oakland. Where no one would recognize us.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: And how long have you been sleeping with Mrs. Windham?

turns.speaker: ENRIQUE
turns.text: Three months.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: And what is your boyfriend's name?

turns.speaker: ENRIQUE
turns.text: Chuck.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: She's naked.

turns.speaker: MRS. WINDHAM VANDERMARK
turns.text: I'm covered in very expensive Egyptian mud -- hardly naked.

turns.speaker: MRS. WINDHAM VANDERMARK
turns.text: So, I hear the tart from California shot Heyworth.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Well, that's what we're trying to prove didn't happen. Do you have any reason to believe it did?

turns.speaker: MRS. WINDHAM VANDERMARK
turns.text: I never met the woman, but from what my daughter tells me, she's quite the cun --

turns.speaker: MRS. WINDHAM VANDERMARK
turns.text: Aside from the fact that he found her on an infomercial? She said they humped like gorillas. Chutney could hear them all the way in the pool house.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I' m sure that was very awkward for Chutney.  Much as it is for me, hearing you tell about it.

turns.speaker: MRS. WINDHAM VANDERMARK
turns.text: But I guess it wasn't enough for Brooke.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Why do you say that?

turns.speaker: MRS. WINDHAM VANDERMARK
turns.text: Haven't you seen the cabana boy?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Hovering?

turns.speaker: MRS. WINDHAM VANDERMARK
turns.text: I didn't stick around long enough to watch him stick his swizzle stick in her mouth, but I'd bet my next check that that's where he was about to put it.

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Elle?

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: Where's the Rock?

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: Is it a Kappa?

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: It's not a Theta --

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Oh, God. What if Josh doesn't think I'm serious enough?

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: Helloo... you let him have anal sex with you.  Helloo... you let him videotape you diddling yourself.

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: You're right. Phew!

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: What's the thing that always makes us feel better, no matter what?

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Cunnilingus?

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Let's all go! Road trip!

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: Wait -- Cecil has a condo in Tahoe. Let's go there!

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Why?!

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: I mean, I know you're upset and all, but can't you just take a sedative?

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: You passed Spanish because you gave Professor Montoya a hand-job after the final.

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Yeah, luckily.

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: There he is!

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Pull up next to him!

turns.speaker: 1ST DEMON
turns.text: Why so few?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Faith.

turns.speaker: 1ST DEMON
turns.text: Fool's magic.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Precisely.  Faith has persuaded them a pygmie with a sling can kill an armed giant.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Fight's over before it's begun... soon the survivors will be in full retreat.

turns.speaker: 1ST DEMON
turns.text: Then we smash 'em?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Anything left for smashing you may happily smash.

turns.speaker: 1ST DEMON
turns.text: You go?  Not watch fun?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: I have something far more pleasant awaiting me.

turns.speaker: 1ST DEMON
turns.text: We come watch... we come watch...

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Nay.  This is a private affair, no audience welcome... Better you watch the dismantling of our enemies... and, look you, see the moat is set aflame.

turns.speaker: 1ST DEMON
turns.text: Fire moat... why do that?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Purely a precaution...

turns.speaker: 2ND DEMON
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Delusion... a kind of magic which works against the magician.

turns.speaker: 2ND DEMON
turns.text: Dumb magic.  Giant smash peewee.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Always.

turns.speaker: 2ND DEMON
turns.text: We go out, smash 'em now?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: No.  Smashing is not required.  I have a surprise for our tiny invaders... Raise that hatch!

turns.speaker: 2ND DEMON
turns.text: Birdies... pretty...

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: I doubt the faeries will admire their beauty... Come, this will be fun to watch.

turns.speaker: 2ND DEMON
turns.text: We watch... good fun...

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Indeed, the best of fun... Enjoy yourselves.

turns.speaker: 2ND DEMON
turns.text: More fun win battle?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: This is another victory, my friends. What began with the lash shall be concluded with a caress.

turns.speaker: 2ND DEMON
turns.text: You go to lady now?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: To finish last evening's delightful work.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: My generosity is not so large as that.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: What do you want with me?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Your love.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Your words sting more sharply than your whip.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: I speak of love, and you think only of the lash.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: You are cruel!  Your heartless jesting worse than torture!  How can you speak of love when you see what I am!

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: I like well what I see.  It pleases me.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: But I'm hideous!

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: You're magnificent.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Grotesque... monstrous...

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: On the contrary!  The puling, pallid creature you were before was truly something disgusting.  Now you are splendid... a fierce goddess... the embodiment of all that is strong and beautiful.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: You lie!  You wish to humiliate me, as if the form I'm forced to bear were not punishment enough!

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: You should glory in your animal nature.  It is your triumph!  None know that better than I!

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: God protect me.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Not from me, surely...

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: You... you're a beast!

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: We're all of us beasts, my dear. Only most are afraid to show it.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: And you... are you not also afraid?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: I am afraid of nothing.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Then why hide behind a mask?  You are ashamed!

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: I know no more of shame than I do of fear.  I wear this mask not for concealment but protection.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Protection?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: I am a creature of darkness.  I require the shadow's solace and the black of night... Sunlight is abhorrent to me... I cover myself completely whenever I venture forth in daylight... Sunshine is my destroyer.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Like some vile toadstool.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: I prefer to think, more like the sagacious owl.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Do you feed on mice and rats?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: I prefer a plump capon, but will happily serve you rats if they're to your liking.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Why have you brought me here?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: To be my bride, of course.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: I'd soon die.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Damn you!

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: We're both of us damned, my beauty.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: When the time's come, you won't need to jump, I'll throw you out myself!

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Do it now!

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: No.  Now is the time for discipline. Some lessons in obedience for the future Baroness.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Jack... Oh, Jack... Help me...

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Too bad your precious Jack can't hear you... the damsel in distress... A rescue attempt would be most amusing... We could flay sweet Jack alive as an after-dinner entertainment...

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Your moans seem almost pleasurable, my dear... developing a taste for the lash?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Kill me... I want... so nice...

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Why should I kill you?  A simple course in etiquette... something your parents sadly overlooked.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: No more... please...

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: I can keep a victim alive for weeks... months, if I desire it... it's an art.  They beg for death... I keep it just out of their reach.  The pain remains constant.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Don't please... I'll do what you desire...

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Sweet Princess, you begin to sound most reasonable.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: What do you want from me?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: At the moment, very little.  Your company at my table...

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: We'll get you cleaned up, find a suitable gown... I imagine you'll enjoy a good meal?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Oh, yes...

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: A few day's nourishment will see your strength returning.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: And then?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: What will become of me then?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: When you are ripe for my pleasure, I will enjoy the harvest.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: I see...

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: I'm pleased you're not troubled by the prospect...

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Do as you wish with my body, you'll never possess my soul!

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Your soul...?  Why should I bother with such a paltry trifle?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: I don't expect you'd understand.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: My dear Princess, the human soul is a highly elusive commodity.  I suggest you spend some hours before the glass.  Contemplate your intriguing reflection and consider whether such a creature as yourself could possibly possess something as fine and beautiful as a soul.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: You're a beast!

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Indeed I am, my dear... that makes us a pair!

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: What was that?  Did you hear that?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: It's nothing.  My men take great delight in routing the enemy.  Don't trouble yourself, beauty.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: It sounded like it came from the courtyard.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: From the parapets most likely.  The men are amused by a battlefield entertainment of my own contriving.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Might we watch, too?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Later, beloved... Now I wish only to be with you...

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: And I with you... I never dreamed life held such pleasures...

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Pleasure is for those who seize it! Do you think those insipid, pale- skinned mortals will ever know such rapture?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: It's odd... when I first found myself... changing... I was sick with loathing and disgust.  I thought I was so ugly I wanted to die...

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: And, now?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Now I want to live forever.  I've never felt so strong or happy.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Or looked so beautiful...

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Yes.  I feel that, too.  Weakness is what is ugly.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Precisely, my darling.  Your animal strength, your primitive power has surfaced... you are what you desire.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: To be strong and free... that is all I desire.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: So you shall be... Like our brothers, the hawk and the wolf, our spirits know no master... we are created in the pure image of the savage God that set our turbulent universe in motion.

turns.speaker: DRAGON
turns.text: What you do, boy?  You be velly solly, come here intellupt my sleep.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I didn't know... I --

turns.speaker: DRAGON
turns.text: What?  Speakee loud!  No hear velly good.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I said, I mean no harm... I thought this as empty tomb.

turns.speaker: DRAGON
turns.text: You come stealee tleasoo?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh, no, never... nothing like that... never crossed my mind.

turns.speaker: DRAGON
turns.text: No need lie, boy.  I no hurt you. Do I look like I wanna hurt you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, er... no.  I mean, you don't look like dragons I've heard of.

turns.speaker: DRAGON
turns.text: Course not.  I no flum here.  I come flum Cathay.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Cathay?

turns.speaker: DRAGON
turns.text: Country fa' fa' away.  To the East, beyond the lising sun...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: East of Mercia?

turns.speaker: DRAGON
turns.text: You got no idee.  People there lookee diffelent; speakee diffelent. Nothing the same.  In my countlee I bling good luck.  Makee lain and thunder.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You don't ravage the countryside, devouring maidens and burning the crops?

turns.speaker: DRAGON
turns.text: Dlagon not like that.  Dlagon is spilit of life... spilit of stlength and goodness.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Then you'll understand my quest.  An ogre named Blackheart has killed the last stag unicorn and stolen his horn.  The world outside is cursed, plunged into eternal winter.  Unless I return the alicorn, the earth will be frozen forever.

turns.speaker: DRAGON
turns.text: Flozen foleva not good.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's terrible.

turns.speaker: DRAGON
turns.text: An' how you do it?  How you rift cuss?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I need your help.  In order to fight Blackheart, I must wear the armor of Achilles.  I --

turns.speaker: DRAGON
turns.text: You come stealee tleasoo?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh no... Don't you understand?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, wait... please... listen...

turns.speaker: DRAGON
turns.text: No more listening!  Your time is at an end, insignificant whelp!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Friend Ogg.  Excuse our enthusiasm, occasioned as it was by a fondness for you.

turns.speaker: OGG
turns.text: Honeythorn Gump, is it?  I've not seen your ugly face since you sold me a jug of cow piss claiming it was dragon's tears.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Well, bygones're bygones, I always say.

turns.speaker: OGG
turns.text: Or was it the time you and Jimmy Squarefoot stole the golden apples I'd forged.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Twas Jimmy done that, I merely stood for the blame unfairly... but, here now, Ogg, this be no time to rehash old differences, I've friends along in need of safe haven for the night.

turns.speaker: OGG
turns.text: Who might these friends be?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Screwball you know, and many other of the wee folk.  We serve as escort for our grand champion, Jack o' the Green.

turns.speaker: OGG
turns.text: Baron Couer de Noir is a blight 'gainst all nature.  We dwarves be not fighters; still we are with you in this battle.  Some of our handiwork may be of assistance.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: We be honored, friend Ogg.

turns.speaker: OGG
turns.text: There's a coil of golden thread fine as spider web yet naught can break it... and a silver key no lock can resist.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: So, Jack... think you be a Green Man and not know Gump.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Gump, is it?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Aye, Honeythorn Gump, come to serenade you, Jack... come to make you dance.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm in no mood for dancing.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Oh, but you will be, Jack... Think you to sleep in a faerie ring and not spend the night a-dancing?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Faerie ring?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: To be sure.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No!  Tis not the time!  I want no part of your frolic.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Dance, Jack!  The night's but begun.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Enough!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: And how is it a mortal dare dictate to the faerie folk?  Is me music not to your liking?  Mayhap the dance of death by more your pleasure.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No... I... I need to rest.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: You'll have a long, long rest in the tomb, me lad.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I meant no disrespect.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Didn't you now?  Well then, answer me this riddle and all be forgiven.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And if I cannot?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Why, Jack, then tis your death song I'll be strumming.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's bluebells!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: What!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The flower.  Bluebells.  To hear them ringing means your life's at an end.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Damnation!  Codfish and cockles! Gammon and trotters!  You've bested me, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A riddle without an answer is but an empty cup when you're thirsty for wine.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Well spoke.  True to the mark.  And if it's wine you're wanting, it's wine we shall have.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: You be our guest, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm honored, Honeythorn Gump... but no more tricks.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: You have me word, lad.  To answer a faerie riddle deserves as much.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Twas the Princess Lili gave me the answer... have you seen her, by chance?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: I've laid eyes on no mortal but you this day, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I fear she's lost.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Mayhap you be the one what's lost, and she safe by the castle hearth... but, come Jack, we'll warm your bones.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Why, Jack-lad, she likes you, is all.  And what hot-blooded hero wouldn't welcome the affections of a fair nymph like Oona here...?  If your blood runs so cold, boy, you be a corpse before your time.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What does she want from me?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Elderberry wine.  No finer drink under heaven.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It looks... er, delicious...  Such a fine bouquet... very aromatic...

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Are ye afraid of me wine?  Did your momma tell ye never to take food nor drink from the Wee Folk?  Think if ye sup with the faeries you'll be enchanted?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well... I... I don't want to be rude, but... it's generally known that --

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Generally known!  What general ever knew more than to lace up his boots?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Please don't misunderstand.  I am grateful for your hospitality and --

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: He is afraid of enchantment!  Will you listen to the fool prattle on.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But... but, why?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Big question that, lad.  Why what?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why has this happened to the world? Why is it winter now, and dark?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Aye.  Honeythorn Gump'd be a powerful wizard indeed could he answer.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't you know?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: If you're looking for enchantment, Jack, that I can give thee...

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: That much magic I can offer ye, a small measure of entertainment at best.  Making the world a frozen hell is beyond me modest powers.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Then, what's gone wrong?  Why did it happen?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: If ye want more tricks, I'm your man, but for big questions ye must go elsewhere.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't you care about what's happened?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Course we care.  What good's the world locked in a season of death. Frozen up, no folks to scare out of their wits on a summer's night; no babies to tickle; no more spells to cast... Think that's an enjoyable prospect?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There must be an answer somewhere.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: True... But it won't come easy or free.  If ye want to ask, ask Jenny Greenteeth.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Jenny Greenteeth?  Who's she?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Someone worthy of respect, lad.  She be a water spirit, lives in a bog down at sea-side.  Hideous creature to look at, even by my doubtful standards; devours little children, she does, when she can catch them.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How is it this hag knows the truth?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Think there be truth only in beauty, lad?  If you've the courage to ask and take care to avoid her terrible claws, Jenny Greenteeth has the answers you seek.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Will you lead me to her?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Aye.  On the morrow we go, but tonight...  ... tonight is for making merry.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Are we here?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Aye.  That foul wallow be where Jenny Greenteeth dwells.  Oona... lure her out.  Play the part of a girl-child.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What do I do?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Don't get caught, that's what! She'll suck your bones like honey- comb.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Here now.  Toss her this when you've the chance.  Jenny Greenteeth can't resist the sight of herself in a glass.  She's terribly vain.  Praise her beauty and you'll lull her sweet as a babe in a cradle.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And if she thinks me a liar?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Fie on what she thinks!  You mind her claws and teeth... Cast your spell, Oona.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The princess is dead.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Lamentable news, Jack... but tis the fate of the living concerns us now.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Did you hear?  Twas the killing of the unicorn caused it.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Aye.  Black Baron's mischief.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: If the horn be restored the curse is ended.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Time for a champion.  Can you do more than pick acorns and rob bird's nests, Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll do what I have to do, for Princess Lili's sake!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Bravely spoke.  You've the heart of a champion, true enough.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Twill take more than heart.  Where do we find the armor of Achilles, for a start?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: I know where to find it.  Taking possession be another matter.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: There it be, lad.  The Lindfarne Mound.  Kings long forgotten lie there, lost in their final sleep.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Have we turned grave-robber, then?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: A tomb it once was, boy, and a tomb it may yet be... There's another in residence at Lindfarne now.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And who might that be?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: No less a creature than the Lindfarne Worm.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So I'm to be a dragon-slayer, is that it?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Now, Jack-lad, no one's asking ye to skewer the worm.  Even St. Michael'd have a job on his hands for all that.  But the serpent hoards a pile of booty, Achilles' armor among his treasures... if we find our way within the mound and him asleep...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Knaves and robbers...

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Better pray the worm's a sound sleeper, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You do the praying.  I've work ahead.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: There's the spirit, lad.  If ye run into trouble, give a yank here and we'll haul ye up.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What's left of me... How do I recognize the armor of Achilles?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: You'll know it when you see it... tis a splendid sight, all covered with gold... Don't fear making noise.  Dragons be deaf as tree stumps.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: There be no finer victuals than worm flesh, lad.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Better we eat him than the other way round.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: By the grace of God.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: No false modesty, lad.  You're a proper champion.  Achilles' armor sits on you like it was forged to fit.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I believe this is a sword such as the archangels wield.  Surely St. Michael had so fine a blade when he drove the serpent from heaven.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Well then, you've got the sword and you've got the armor; all's lacking is the steed.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Shhhh!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Screwball!  You dolt!  I've a mind to change you into a toad.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Something's coming.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Pregnant, is she?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It would appear so.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Damn them!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Careful, lad.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Don't see why I can't ride, too! I'm second in command, damn it!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The colt's still too small.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: I'm small... and I can make myself smaller still... Small as a bee! Small as dust...!  Want to see me do it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We've no time for tricks this day, Honeythorn Gump.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Tricks, is it?  Why I'll trick ye! Ungrateful whelp!  I'll sour your milk and bird droppings'll fall from the sky wherever ye walk.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Save your mischief for the Black Baron.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Aye!  That too.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You'll need more than bird droppings for Blackheart.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: I'll drop a cow on the knave!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Drop a mountain on him and we won't need our troops.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Fine-looking army.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We march on Castle Couer de Noir within the hour.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: How do you plan on finding this here castle, if ye don't mind me asking?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A true and troubling question, Gump... We'll start from where the unicorn was killed.  The Baron must have left a trail.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Track the demon to his lair.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Aye.  And hang his foul hide up like dirty laundry for the drying.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We must follow that bird.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Whatever for?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Jenny Greenteeth said:  "Follow the raven in her flight..."

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Aye.  Said to follow it to the edge of night.  But is this the right bird?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm sure.  It spoke to me.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Birds speak to me all the time. What did it say?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Beware.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Sounds like the bird we want.  All right lads, follow yon raven!
